models¶

class gus2.gus_users.models.UserManager[source]¶
create_user(username, email, password)[source]¶

this will create a new user and insert it into the table

@type username:string @param username: The Username of the user to add @type email:string @param email: The email of the user to add @type password:string @param password: the plaintext password for the user to add @rtype:gus_roles.models.gus_user @return: the newly created user

>>>gus_user.objects.create_user(‘username’,’email’,’password’) (<gus_user object>)
class gus2.gus_users.models.gus_user(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

class gus_user model is our model of a user of the gus system

it shall encompass all of the data and all of the discreet functionality of users of the gus system

tests¶

This file demonstrates two different styles of tests (one doctest and one unittest). These will both pass when you run “manage.py test”.

Replace these with more appropriate tests for your application.

class gus2.gus_users.tests.SimpleTest(methodName='runTest')[source]¶
